sentences.english: I lurk at the end of the queue and persuade him to go for coffee.
sentences.chinese: 我悄悄跟在队伍的末尾并说服了他出去喝杯咖啡。

sentences.english: He lowered his voice to a whisper.
sentences.chinese: 他压低了声音悄悄地说话。

sentences.english: Mao Shouliang quietly sneaked into the brothel, he saw Mr Broadband man at the door.
sentences.chinese: 毛寿良悄悄溜入青楼，他看到冯正宽带人在门口。

sentences.english: They silently split off the ball.
sentences.chinese: 他们悄悄地离开了舞会。

sentences.english: The farmer secretly hid the yellow dirt which was picked up by the roadside.
sentences.chinese: 这个农民把在路边捡到的黄金悄悄地藏了起来。

sentences.english: '" Then David crept up unnoticed and cut off a corner of Saul's robe.
sentences.chinese: 大卫就起来，悄悄地割下扫罗外袍的衣襟。

sentences.english: Slipping out of the village I headed for the city of Jian.
sentences.chinese: 我悄悄溜出村，向吉安县城走去。

sentences.english: The two girls sat in a corner exchanging confidences .
sentences.chinese: 那两个女孩子坐在角落里说著悄悄话。

sentences.english: Mr Chan shirks the responsibility of paying the debts. He secretly left Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 陈先生为了逃避债务的责任，便悄悄地离开了香港。

sentences.english: They heard a tap at the door.
sentences.chinese: 他们听见悄悄的拍门声。

sentences.english: These drow Nisstyre was quietly seeking out.
sentences.chinese: 尼赛迪尔正在悄悄地寻找这些卓尔。

sentences.english: He resumed painting secretly, and went sketching in Zhongshan Park, painting flower-and-bird volumes.
sentences.chinese: 开始悄悄作画，去中山公园写生，作花鸟册页等。

sentences.english: One day, forgiveness will tiptoe in and take up gentle occupancy in your heart.
sentences.chinese: 总有一天，宽容会悄悄地来，温柔地入住你的心房。

sentences.english: The waiter ghosted up to the table.
sentences.chinese: 侍者静悄悄地走到桌旁。

sentences.english: She let herself out of the house very quietly.
sentences.chinese: 她静悄悄地从屋里溜出来。

definition: cautious and solemn (idiom); very carefully/prudent/gently and cautiously
